citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the acquisition records were incomplete. The names and addresses of the individuals or entities,
from which 24 dog hybrids were acquired, was recorded. However, none of the records included the driver’s license
number or state issued identification card for these non-USDA licensed/registered individuals or entities.
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of disposition are essential
for proper identification and necessary to track animals used in regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and
disposition.
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition and disposition for each dog or cat, including
animals born on the premises, and assure that all records are complete and kept as required. To be corrected from this
day forward.

At the time of inspection, the acquisition records were incomplete. The names and addresses of the individuals or entities,
from which numerous regulated animals were acquired, was recorded. However, none of the records included the driver’s
license number or state issued identification card for these non-USDA licensed/registered individuals or entities.
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of disposition are essential
for proper identification and necessary to track animals used in regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and
disposition.
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition and disposition for all regulated animals, including
animals born on the premises, and assure that all records are complete and kept as required. To be corrected from this
day forward.

The primary enclosure for the dog hybrid named “Jewel” has an elevated wooden den. The roof of this den is composed
of ¾ inch plywood approximately 4’X6’ in dimension. The layers of this piece of plywood are starting to separate and show
signs of deterioration.
Primary enclosures that are not kept in good repair may lead to injury or negatively affect the health and welfare of the
animal.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound and must
be kept in good repair. To be corrected by May 26, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
David Mersereau, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1)(iii) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
At the time of inspection, the acquisition records were incomplete. The names and addresses of the individuals or entities, 
from which 24 dog hybrids were acquired, was recorded. However, none of the records included the driver’s license 
number or state issued identification card for these non-USDA licensed/registered individuals or entities. 
 
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of disposition are essential 
for proper identification and necessary to track animals used in regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and 
disposition. 
 
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition and disposition for each dog or cat, including 
animals born on the premises, and assure that all records are complete and kept as required. To be corrected from this 
day forward. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors.

At the time of inspection, the acquisition records were incomplete. The names and addresses of the individuals or entities, 
from which numerous regulated animals were acquired, was recorded. However, none of the records included the driver’s 
license number or state issued identification card for these non-USDA licensed/registered individuals or entities. 
 
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of disposition are essential 
for proper identification and necessary to track animals used in regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and 
disposition.  
 
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition and disposition for all regulated animals, including 
animals born on the premises, and assure that all records are complete and kept as required. To be corrected from this 
day forward. 
3.6(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The primary enclosure for the dog hybrid named “Jewel” has an elevated wooden den.  The roof of this den is composed 
of ¾ inch plywood approximately 4’X6’ in dimension. The layers of this piece of plywood are starting to separate and show 
signs of deterioration. 
 
Primary enclosures that are not kept in good repair may lead to injury or negatively affect the health and welfare of the 
animal. 
 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound and must 
be kept in good repair.  To be corrected by May 26, 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
David Mersereau, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
